definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°
pincers/pliers/tongs/claw (of animal)/to grasp with pincers/to pinch/to clamp/to restrain/to restrict/to gag

sentences.english: I have the fingernail clippers you want.
As you can see, the clippers have another attachment namely a magnifying glass.
sentences.chinese: 正如你所見，這個指甲鉗配有一個放大鏡。

sentences.english: She never bothered to file her nails: she just clipped them.
sentences.chinese: 即‘她懶得用指甲銼，歷來都是用指甲鉗’。

sentences.english: These cutters or Seki Edge easy view nail clippers are a wonderful but amusing item.
sentences.chinese: 這些Seki指甲鉗真是奇妙又有趣的產品。

definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
(idiom) with everyone lending a hand (eagerly but somewhat chaotically)
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
